attachments.text: Are you frustrated because your content strategy is not generating leads? It is probably because you are making these 7 mistakes. Here's how to fix it.

text:
Hey all! Our team had the pleasure of interviewing the great Rand Fishkin of Moz and SparkToro on our podcast, Founder Chats.

In this conversation, Rand talks about
• the problems with hustle culture
• his alternative approach (called chill work)
• why finding alternatives to VC funding is a better option for most companies & more! 
I’m relatively early in my career, but his ideas gave me a lot of hope for what work can actually be like. I really enjoyed this conversation and think others here will too!

Tune in here: <http://buff.ly/3AbTFYa|buff.ly/3AbTFYa>

text:
:blue_car: Rideshare insurance can sound like a tricky case to work on, however, if you break it into stages and consistently dig into each of them, you will see a number of opportunities to improve your customer experience. To shed more light on how to do this, I would like to share with you a recording of the session that covers the entire process of mapping out the journey of a rideshare insurance customer with the help of UXPressia customer journey map online tool from scratch. 

The session starts with defining basic stages:
• research, 
• purchase,
• usage
 and sections: 
• goals, 
• channels, 
• problems, 
• and others
 to describe each stage.

At the end of the session, you will get a complete template with the finished structure of the map:world_map: which you will be able to download and use, including all stages, substages, questions, processes, and channels. Also, you will see a storyboard that gives a better visualization of the customer’s actions.

Follow the link <https://bit.ly/InsuranceCaseWalkthrough> to grasp even more insights about the typical causes of customer pains and key moments of truth in the insurance sphere to deliver the best experience to your customer!:raised_hands:

attachments.fallback: YouTube: How to Create a Customer Journey Map: Insurance Case Walkthrough
attachments.title: How to Create a Customer Journey Map: Insurance Case Walkthrough
attachments.text: In this session, we explore how to create a customer journey map in UXPressia. We walk through the case of buying rideshare insurance and show you different ...

text:
Hi everyone. I have a new thing. I'm hoping it helps teams make the most of customer research interviews. I'm calling it a "DIT" (Do-it-together). Here's the rundown.

:mag_right: We interview one customer together, so you can watch and absorb.
:mag_right: You conduct two interviews and I will give notes and feedback on how you did.
:mag_right: We start a custom research report to organize the findings.
:mag_right: I give you a game plan for turning insights -> marketing actions

I find many teams want to leverage customer research but aren't always sure how to do it. I think this may help some folx (specifically copy, content and product people). More in this <https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6857295715270492160/|LI post> or on my site <http://contentlift.io|contentlift.io>

text:
Extremely honored to be the highlighted career changer feature on the CompTIA website today. While I stepped more into writing about cybersecurity and technology than the technical side, it was nice to live memory lane and why I got started in the first place. Here is the article if you would like to give it a read.
<https://www.comptia.org/blog/career-change-to-cybersecurity>

attachments.title: How I Transitioned into Cybersecurity from the Insurance Industry
attachments.text: Learn how one IT pro leveraged her security mindset and problem-solving skills to start a new career in cybersecurity.
attachments.fallback: Default: How I Transitioned into Cybersecurity from the Insurance Industry

text:
:money_mouth_face: Have you given much thought to what happens _*after someone lands on your page from SEO.*_ Your organic search traffic strategy is only as good as your ability to _*convert the search traffic into leads and bottom-line revenue*_.

Join guest speaker Tom Shapiro for a webinar on how to effectively convert organic traffic into $$$. The presentation will touch upon concepts including:
• Content for 5X Growth
• The Power of Extreme Creativity
• Audience Alignment
• Tools
• Original Research
• Brainstorm Titles
• IP Detection
• Evoke an Emotional Response
• Design Matters
• CTA Optimization
• Behavioral Intelligence
• Build Trust
• Test Test Test
:spiral_note_pad: *Details:*
** Title:* Crazy Effective Conversion Strategies for SEO Content
** Speaker:* <https://www.linkedin.com/in/tomshapiro/|Tom Shapiro>, CEO at <https://stratabeat.com/|Stratabeat>
** Date & time:* Thursday, October 28th, 11:00 AM US Central Time
** Zoom registration page:* <https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/3316349179946/WN_Hw7GBJt4Q5qi4GdbN7JEoA>
** Who should attend:* Attend this webinar for an in-depth analysis on how AI will shape the role of content & SEO. We'll cover the advantages and disadvantages of using AI-generated content (GPT-3) and back up those claims using real-world examples.

RSVP to attend live OR receive the webinar recording in your inbox if you can't make it :inbox_tray:

Ever thought about taking 1 blog post and creating 9 more marketing materials with it?

After writing a tutorial recently, I wanted to see how many ways I could repurpose the article into another piece of content.

Here are 9 ways you can repurpose an article....
